result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:24 PM UDAR ENDS
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jessica Dawn Sampe in court.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Jessica Dawn Sampe.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 21CF-531 and 22CM-31.

12:05 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing to resolve both matters. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
21CF-531: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in.
22CM-31: Would be dismissed and read in.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant understands the agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF-531: Count 2: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 in 21CF-531. 943.38(1).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
21CF-531: Count 1: Dismissed and read in.
21CF-531: Count 3: Dismissed and read in.
22CM-31: Dismissed and read in.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes in both cases. 
Victim is not present.
Restitution summary is addressed. 

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
21CF-531:
Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 48 months.
Initial Confinement for 18 months.
Extended Supervision for 30 months.
Eligible for substance abuse program.
Eligible for challenge incarceration program.
Imposed and Stayed.
Probation for a period of 4 years.
Conditions:
Participate in the Portage County Drug Treatment Court Program to its successful conclusion.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Take all prescriptions as prescribed.
Attend further counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Do not knowingly be in the presence of anyone using illegal controlled substances.
Pay restitution of $200.
Pay costs and surcharges.
Submit DNA Sample.
Pay DNA Surcharge. 

Court addresses the waiver form for the program. Defendant replies, has been turned in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from JusticePoint dated 07/14/22 in re:  defendant is eligible for the Portage County Adult Drug Treatment Court
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 8/8/22 at 10:00 a.m. - Defendant is being assessed for Treatment Court
Cell Phone Updated Only
Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a PTC on 07/05/2022 at 10:00 a.m. - Defendant has another case set for pretrial at same date/time. She is currently being assessed for drug court participation.
Pre-trial conference on July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
